questions.question_text: Which three actions are required to configure a highly available and secure hybrid network between Oracle Cloud and your data center? (Choose three.)

choices.E: Create dynamic routing gateways in more than one AD within your region.
choices.A: Define a non-overlapping IP Address Space between the data center and the cloud.
choices.D: Define a default route table entry for the VCN that directs all traffic to the data center network to a single DRG.
choices.B: Configure each of the CPEs to leverage each of the IPSec Tunnels created by the connection process.
choices.C: Create two or more CPEs that map to the private IP addresses of the customer routers used in the IPSec VPN Tunnel.

discussion.content: I think Answer is A,B,D
Correct Answer is A,B,D

The person who gave the answer for this test have made the exam at least 10 times to pass it.
Only few system answers are right.

:D
ABD is correct. E make no sense. C is wrong as CPE map to public IPs.
Is c not wrong as it says private up should be public up

Answer is A,B,C 
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/Network/Tasks/configuringCPE.htm

comments.content: D states "Define a default route table entry for the VCN". Route tables are applied at subnet level, there's not such thing as a route table for the VCN.

discussion.content:
From course notes
DRG is used for both IPsec and Fastconnect, it has 1:1 relation with the VCN, one VCN has only one DRG and one DRG can be assigned only to one VCN.
Ther is only ONE DRG per VCN.
Correct answer is ABD

I think A, B, D are correct. 

"When you create an IPSec VPN, it has two redundant IPSec tunnels. Oracle encourages you to configure your CPE to use both tunnels (if your CPE supports it). Note that in the past, Oracle created IPSec VPNs that had up to four IPSec tunnels." Source - OCI user guide
It's A,B,C correct REF= https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/General/Concepts/servicelimits.htm only 1 VCN attached to DRG and 5 DRG's per Region MAX

Agree with ABC. DE don't make sense.

Not the best question either.
It's A, B, C,. D makes no sense to put a default route to only one DRG. And E makes no sense because you can only put 1 DRG per VCN.

questions.question_text: Which tool can automatically install Oracle Cloud Infrastructure CLI?

discussion.content: correct D. python is the language who runs pip
The installer script automatically installs the CLI and its dependencies, Python and virtualenv. So the correct answer is A.
Which is correct? I am really confused but the given solution and the debate between you all.

comments.content: Which is correct? I am really confused by the given solution and the debate between you all.

discussion.content: D. pip is a de facto standard package-management system used to install and manage software packages written in Python

comments.content:
PiP stands for "Package Installer for Python", just like APT in linux, it's a tool
https://www.journaldev.com/33905/install-pip-linux
Phyton is a language not a tool

discussion.content: A is the answer,PiP is a command not tool

Answer is D.
This is the command you run 
pip install oci_cli-*-py2.py3-none-any.whl
REF: https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/API/SDKDocs/climanualinst.htm
A =If you use the CLI installer and do not have Python on your machine, the installer offers to automatically install Python for you.

pip is a one command to run assuming Python is there
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/API/SDKDocs/climanualinst.htm
pip install ocicli
Correct A,D
DE, yep.
DE is correct

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure object storage service? (Choose two.)

choices.B: It can be directly attached to or detached from a compute instance.
choices.A: It provides higher IOPS than block storage.
choices.C: Data is stored redundantly in a single AD.
choices.D: Data is stored redundantly across multiple availability domains (ADs).

questions.question_text: What does Terraform use to create, manage, and manipulate infrastructure resources?

discussion.content: Providers. Terraform is used to create, manage, and update infrastructure resources such as physical machines, VMs, network switches, containers, and more

choices.C: Single Instance database with a Single Instance Data Guard in Maximum Protection mode
choices.B: Single Instance database with a Single Instance Data Guard in Maximum Performance mode
choices.D: Two node Primary RAC database with a two node RAC Data Guard Standby in Maximum Performance mode
choices.A: Two node Primary RAC database leveraging ACFS for the shared file system

discussion.content: B is correct. https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/database-dbaas-cloud/csdbi/db-deployments.html#GUID-ABDB48B9-01F5-4F32-AD35-08251F67B641

B.

the RAC config is not available on ORacle cloud infrastructure.
B is correct. DBCS supports RAC while OCI (instance) only supports instance.
Answer is D.

B.

The key word is "onto Oracle cloud infrastructure"
Not sure D is correct, B may be correct. https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/database-dbaas-cloud/csdbi/db-deployments.html#GUID-61C0A3F6-1760-47EC-8B3E-8B50AE1276D9
